item.title: Levinas -- "Suffering and Death"
item.description: “Suffering and Death”1 — Levinas Emmanuel Levinas, “Suffering and Death,” Time & the Other, trans. Richard A. Cohen (Pittsburg, Pennsylvania: Duquesne UP, 1987), p. 68–71. (Text below is excerpted from “Suffering and Death”) In pain, sorrow, and suffering, we once again find, in a state of purity, the finality that constitutes the tragedy of {page break; 68} solitude. The ecstasies of enjoyment does not succeed in surmounting this finality.
